content:
I’m an MD/PhD student at the University of Washington’s MSTP. I’m currently in the PhD phase of my training at the Allen School of Computer Science and Engineering, where I’m being advised by Su-In Lee. My research focuses on studying robust and explainable machine learning with applications ranging from precision oncology to radiology.
When I’m not in lab, you can probably find me biking, running, or hiking with my partner Sam and our dog Toby.
summary: I’m an MD/PhD student at the University of Washington’s MSTP. I’m currently in the PhD phase of my training at the Allen School of Computer Science and Engineering, where I’m being advised by Su-In Lee.
title: Joseph D. Janizek

summary: Published in __Bioinformatics__, selected for oral presentation at the _European Conference on Computational Biology_ 2020.
title: Adversarial Deconfounding Autoencoder for Learning Robust Gene Expression Embeddings

summary: Spotlight presentation at ACM CHIL 2020 for research paper "An adversarial approach for the robust classification of pneumonia from chest radiographs"
title: Learning to robustly classify chest radiographs

summary: Short paper selected for spotlight presentation at the __ICML Workshop on Human Interpretability__ 2020.
title: True to the model, or true to the data?

summary: Spotlight presentation at ICML WHI 2020 discussing the selection of set function when using Shapley values for model explanation.
title: True to the model, or true to the data?

summary: A repository for explaining feature importances and feature interactions in deep neural networks using path attribution methods (Integrated Gradients and Integrated Hessians)
title: Path Explainer

summary: Preprint (under review). An efficient and accurate method (Integrated Hessians) for detecting interactions in neural networks.
title: Explaining Explanations: Axiomatic Feature Interactions for Deep Networks

summary: Published in __Proceedings of the ACM Conference on Health, Inference, and Learning__ 2020.
title: An adversarial approach for the robust classification of pneumonia from chest radiographs

summary: A repository to train confounder-invariant deep learning models for chest radiographs
title: De-confounded Pneumonia Classification

summary: Preprint (under review). A method for jointly learning a deep neural network and a flexible prior on the attributions of that model using meta-features.
title: Learning Deep Attribution Priors Based On Prior Knowledge

summary: Preprint (under review). A method to regularize the attributions of neural networks during the training process.
title: Learning explainable models using attribution priors

summary: A repository with code to regularize a deep learning model's attributions during training in order to learn models with more desirable properties
title: Attribution Priors
Accurate classification of BRCA1 variants with saturation genome editing
Explainable machine learning prediction of synergistic drug combinations for precision cancer medicine
Characterization of the Lipase Stimulating Domain for Apolipoprotein AV and the Development of a Therapeutic Peptide for the Treatment of Hypertriglyceridemia
A Novel Fluorescence-Based Assay is Used to Investigate the Triglyceride Hydrolytic Activity of Lipases and to Identify Synthetic Peptides With Strong Lipase-Stimulating Activities
